channel.title: Error when trying to Run a server after compilation - MAC
channel.description:
once I compile this source and attempt to run the server, this is the error I get. Any ideas as to how to fix this? Been PC my entire life and I decided to try out a mac. Lil more difficult for me lol
*****-MacBook-Pro:BLANK SOURCE **********$ java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server Usage: java [-options] class [args...] (to execute a class) or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args...] (to execute a jar file) where options include: -d32 use a 32-bit data model if available -d64 use a 64-bit data model if available -server to select the "server" VM The default VM is server, because you are running on a server-class machine.
*fixed* tired atm lol... stupid me forgot to change semicolons

item.title: Error when trying to Run a server after compilation - MAC
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

Umm, this is an error I get when trying to compile my server on a mac. I know I have the latest version of Jdk because I just re-dowloaded it and checked java -version in the terminal. Im not really sure as to why it is telling me this.

Basaks-MacBook-Pro:~ basak$ cd /Users/Basak/Desktop/OverloadX\ 317\ Source
Basaks-MacBook-Pro:OverloadX 317 Source basak$ javac *.java
javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Basak-MacBook-Pro:OverloadX 317 Source basak$

Read full topic
item.source: Error when trying to Run a server after compilation - MAC

item.title: Error when trying to Run a server after compilation - MAC
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

On Unix like systems, including the Mac, the path separator character is “:”, not “;”.
Change the semicolons in the command to colons and try it again.

Read full topic
item.source: Error when trying to Run a server after compilation - MAC

@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

IDE’s are completely new to me, I have eclipse downloaded and I’ve been messing around with it, but I have no idea how to incorporate the files from the client into the eclipse

item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

once I compile this source and attempt to run the server, this is the error I get. Any ideas as to how to fix this? Been PC my entire life and I decided to try out a mac. Lil more difficult for me lol

*****-MacBook-Pro:BLANK SOURCE **********$ java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
Usage: java [-options] class [args…]
(to execute a class)
or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)
where options include:
-d32 use a 32-bit data model if available
-d64 use a 64-bit data model if available
-server to select the “server” VM
The default VM is server,
because you are running on a server-class machine.

fixed tired atm lol… stupid me forgot to change semicolons
